snippet: Myrlie Evers-Williams, a former chairwoman of the N.A.A.C.P. who is also the widow of the slain civil rights activist Medgar Evars, will deliver the invocation at President Obama's second inaugural this month, Mr. Obama's inaugural planners said.
abstract: Myrlie Evers-Williams, a former chairwoman of the N.A.A.C.P. who is also the widow of the slain civil rights activist Medgar Evars, will deliver the invocation at President Obama's second inaugural this month, Mr. Obama's inaugural planners said.

headline.main: Widow of Slain Civil Rights Leader to Deliver Invocation at Inauguration
